tool.name: OGS: constructMeshesFromGeometry
tool.description: Galaxy wrapper for the OGS utility 'constructMeshesFromGeometry'.
tool.command: for i in $geometry; do if [ "$i" != "None" ] && [ ! -e "$(basename $i)" ]; then ln -s "$i" "$(basename $i)"; fi; done; for i in $mesh; do if [ "$i" != "None" ] && [ ! -e "$(basename $i)" ]; then ln -s "$i" "$(basename $i)"; fi; done; constructMeshesFromGeometry #if str($searchlength).strip() != 'None' and str($searchlength).strip() != '': --searchlength '$searchlength' #end if --geometry '$geometry.element_identifier' --mesh '$mesh.element_identifier' $multiple_nodes_allowed

param.name: searchlength
param.label: searchlength
param.help: search length determining radius for the node search algorithm. Non-negative floating point number, (min = 0)

param.name: geometry
param.label: geometry
param.help: Input (.gml | .gli). The file the input geometry

param.name: mesh
param.label: mesh
param.help: Input (.vtu). The file the input mesh where the geometry is defined

param.name: multiple_nodes_allowed
param.label: multiple nodes allowed
param.help: Allows multiple mesh nodes in eps environment.

tool.help: This tool runs the **constructMeshesFromGeometry** utility from the OpenGeoSys suite.
